Description: Ostracon, large section of the body of a brown pottery grooved vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and very faint traces of at least six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394712) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394712)
